website_summaries.verdict: The best budget computer cube case with a unique design and high quality features.
pros: Large cube case comes in several colors with clear access panels for a unique look
Capable of supporting dual water radiators for enhanced liquid cooling
Easy to take apart and put back together
cons: Airflow from the front fan is largely blocked by the case frame

customer_reviews.title: i like it
customer_reviews.text: its larger than expected. pretty much the size of a mid tower but wider. it looks really cool though. a little tight to build. optical drive tray will interfere with graphics card in top pci slots. i bought a single fan and that was great. or remove the optical tray if not utilizing one. molex connectors for leds are a little cheap. leds are fixed color and not rgb. i got the rex2 in white and the leds are blue. looks great! 200mm fan in front. 120 or 140 in rear. cant remeber. seems to keep cool nicely.
customer_reviews.author: adam j.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's a little fatter than what I expected, but for my first Micro ATX build, it was really simple. There were a few annoying parts, but they were far and few between. The hardest part was installing the mobo, only because I wasn't used to the way it's setup, and the case was lacking instructions on where to put the screws. I was forced to eye ball it. Not the worst thing in the world, but not something you want to do if you can avoid it. All in all, a really good case. I've built at least 8 PC's through the years, and this case is among my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: MadROMAD

customer_reviews.title: Good case, not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Case seems to be a good quality. The colors were true to images. There instructions are worse than Ikea instructions and due to the shape there is not a lot of room or visibility while building, so I would not recommend it for beginner builders. It comes with a large case fan and a standard sized case fan pre-installed. I was pleasantly surprised that it can fit a 240mm liquid cooling radiator on either the front or top of the case, and still have room for a full-sized graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Christina J. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to house my Plex Media Server. The colors match! Kudos to Rexgear for designing a unique, functional, stylish case and not overcharging for it. From a PC-building standpoint, I did not run into any issues installing custom parts. Unlike the more popular mid-towers, this cube case has a huge open space for cable management, bulky expansion cards, improved airflow, removable HDD cage (awesome!), and a functional vent if you install a ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin first its orange and im a huge orange fan. The case is really built well no issues there. Love how the air flow is on it plus you have fan controls with it as well. Very easy to install my components into it. The only thing i was disappointed in was the front main orange fan was barely bright at all so i replaced it with ones that actually glow orange. But i would defiantly buy it again its worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Solid Sturdy, well made, feature full case.
customer_reviews.text: solid sturdy build. feature full case. comes with a huge 200mm fan in the front. and a 140mm in the back. the top can open and close to allow more or less airflow. dust filters on the front. window is a good size. and the whole body is a solid metal. the face and top plate are a sturdy plastic. its a bit heavy, but it couldent be as sturdy if it weren't . the paintjob is very clean. the front fan comes with LED's that are the same color as the case. and it also has case colored front power LED's that go along the diagonal faceplate, and white HDD LED's that are lined up with the power ones.
customer_reviews.author: moodapiller

customer_reviews.title: Solid case for $40
customer_reviews.text: The case is pretty big, but looks very good. The front fan provides a good airflow, however it does not come with a rear fan. I would have knocked off a star because it did not come with instructions on how to mount the motherboard, but that was the only issue. I had to remove the motherboard tray because the motherboard did not want to comply, btw I had the ASUS Prime B350-E. It was a unique and odd case to work in, but the end result shows that it was worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: A good value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter who's ten picked the case for her first build. the Motherboard plate removes simply making placing the components easy. a Mirco atx mother board covers the cable management Grommets. as another reviewer stated the front fan has one blade that scrapes and a few washers takes care of the issue. everything stock ryzen 3 3200g and supplied cooler, case stays cool with the installed fans plus the cpu fan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best part is look at it its sick as **** call my build the goblin got the green one
customer_reviews.text: sick case really big tho so if your looking for smaller profile skip this one all together it only fits a matx mobo but i think its same height as my full case and about double the width so pretty beefy but if your like me your pc is like part of the decoration for your room this case is really sick fans are almost silent but i dont have to turn them up high because i have a water cooler
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, a little bigger than I thought. Needs a few tweaks to be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Built my new ryzen build in this case last week. I love the design and the fact that the motherboard lays flat which is unique. Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was that the front panel cables were far to short for my liking. Had to stretch them as far as they'd go just to reach the plugs. Because of this there are visible cables between my gtx 1060 and the window, with longer cables they could have easily been routed underneath like all the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Had to get my first one replaced because the power ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to get my first one replaced because the power button stopped working, and with this new one, the fan is scraping against the front casing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner case
customer_reviews.text: This was my first computer build so even those I have no experience with a vertical motherboard configuration and can promise you horizontal is easier to put parts in .I bought this case for a minor gaming rig and I have one complaint and it’s that you can’t see fan lights through the front cover, but other than that it’s easy to assemble, has good preinstalled fans, and An added bonus the red and gold looks like iron man.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. When you get this case, I would recommend you open the top and front of the case and mount the large casefan at the top and remove the optical drive holder to free up video card space.!
customer_reviews.author: NavH

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cheap Steel not aluminum Rolled edges Solid construction Fan controller Cons: Had to remove the plastic top to reroute called and to remove the dvd tray to fit a full size video card just to put it all back in properly. A very fiddly, case reminiscent of the 90s Very tight screws oob too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Wortman

customer_reviews.title: Solid build for your money
customer_reviews.text: Right away the design of this case looked cool compared to the other cases at the $60 price point. Building my computer in this case was a breeze with plenty of room to move around in. I was sad that the window was a bit smaller when I ordered it but I can see into the components still despite my full size GPU. My only complaint would be that the top and front portion of the case are so hard to pull off that it feels like you are going to break it. Still give it 5 stars though.
customer_reviews.author: James E Walker

customer_reviews.title: What do you expect for $60?
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions are wrong on the product page, this case is version 2.0, which is massive compared to the old version. Upon unboxing, the case looks like a child’s toy, extremely plasticky and bulky. I cannot stress this enough, the case looks like a very cheap toy, for children. Build quality seems ok, but between how massive it is and how different it looks when you actually get it, I can’t rate it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: No restart button.  Nice case see pic.
customer_reviews.text: I just opened it today. It has one rear fan, and one large front fan included, and it had metal sides with one see-through panel side. The top is plastic. I don’t yet have all the parts to test that it is functional. It does not have a restart button and just a on/off button. It has two fan speed control nobs for the built in fans. The back has a space for mounting an additional fan. I will enjoy building my system with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Horan

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: This case is a good bang for your buck. The case isn’t tall like most other PC cases, it’s more square therefore is wider than most. It comes with interior blue lighting and a fan control wheel in the top. Materials are decent for the price. The top of the case was a little awkward to remove so I could mount overhead fans, other than that I had little issues. If your graphics card is really chunky, it will a tight fit next to the ram slots.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt. Tester

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work with; Front case fan was temper-mental (sometimes would turn on and other times no); Seller offered to pack back up and ship for return but decided to go with a RGB Coursair and be done with it to finish the build. Case definitely is an eye catcher. I would buy from Rexgear again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McCutcheon

customer_reviews.title: Very large case
customer_reviews.text: Great case , much bigger than expected, 2 case fans that come with it are junk. The case does have excellent air flow, and plenty of room for multiple hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Cwdups

customer_reviews.title: Good Price. Good product. Maybe just a little outdated with the optical drive bay.
customer_reviews.text: I like this case. If your building on micro ATX system this is a pretty good case. The only feature that I wasn't impressed about was the Plexiglas window. I know this is a little bit of an older design, but for the money I thought it was pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: If you hate someone, buy them this case.
customer_reviews.text: Don't do it. Hard to mount the motherboard, the fans clip the edges of the fan casings and make god awful noises.. I had to unplug them. Cable management is non existent.. no dust filtration, just don't do it..
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Look inside the case for the box with the screws. Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and is as described. Having built computers for 10 years, I must say, for $50, this is a nice case, with one of the most interesting designs that I've ever seen to date. The build quality is light years ahead of my NZXT case, and the instructions are straightforward and easy to understand. Couldn't find the screws at first, but found them in the machine in a separate box that blended in with the color of my case. For now, this case looks beautiful, and promising as I have yet to build my machine. Will edit this review as needed. For now, excellent first impression.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case, its got room for plenty of airflow, built in fan controllers and I think best of all very easy to work with, its all pretty simple and there is plenty of room to work with so you don't need to pull everything out to work on it, I would definitely recommend it to anyone new building a Desktop.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a 53xy case
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely very frustrating working inside it, and one screw got stuck and I was forced to break off one of the metal pieces to remove it. Other than that it's solid, I mean just look at it. It's beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not a small case.
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty big actually, maybe just a hair shorter than a standard mid tower but wider for sure, not for narrow enclosures. Seems to have good air flow and looks pretty beastly just not small. The motherboard sits laying down so thats why its so wide.
customer_reviews.author: J-man

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I cant give this anything but five stars. The top "vents" are a little goofy and plasticy, but all in all its hard to find a good case that allows the motherboard to be horizontal and this beats expectations for the price for me.
customer_reviews.author: TheyNamedMeUnlucky

customer_reviews.title: Decent case for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a decent case for the money. The fan controls don't work on our case but my son's setup has plenty of cooling on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C Gorr

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting case
customer_reviews.text: So this is a pretty interesting computer case deafening Decent quality for the money. The only thing that's really cheap is the 2 fans they Provide. Pros: Removable motherboard tray Removable Hard drive cage 2 separate fan speed controller 2 locations to mount a 240 mm or 280 mm radiators Cons: Only one Side panel with a window The front CD/DVD Tray sits a little too low so it will interferes with taller graphics cards. The 2 fan Provided are low quality.
customer_reviews.author: MARVOL

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice case, but it has a few imperfections or ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice case, but it has a few imperfections or details that I did not like. The motherboard has to sit horizontally and if you add a GPU, it will block the view to the CPU thru the window. Cable management is also a negative, because of how the motherboard connectors sit facing the window.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Challenging case for cable management
customer_reviews.text: This case is well built, but cable management is difficult. Make sure your usb3 connector is close to the 24 pin power connect, and not on the end of the board by the rest of the usbs and audio connector. the cable is not long enough to be hidden..
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great case for MATX builds
customer_reviews.text: MATX/ITX awesome case. Really wished I had an MATX mobo so i could have built in it. Had a bad mono and rather than wait I went ahead and got the B450 Tomahawk. The case is nice and spacious, only issue will be making sure cable management doesn't affect airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Great Fantasy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice case for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case for a budget build and was surprised by the quality. We call the pc our Iron Man pc.
customer_reviews.author: John Montani

customer_reviews.title: Good looking case, poor for cable management
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like the look of this case and the design. But there is a flaw in the motherboard placement. It does make it harder to work in and cable management is difficult. But I managed to make it work for me, and im satisfied with the end result
customer_reviews.author: Angel Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, bigger than I thought and in a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, bigger than I thought and in a good way. The green is a very nice color and for the price, I’m glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Deisel

customer_reviews.title: Have small hands
customer_reviews.text: It's a huge case for a micro atx. But its design makes it hard to fit big graphics card in it. But it did fit a gtx dual fan 1060! Besides the tight fit its awsome for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird mobo orientation but looks cool
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Looks like ironman Is small Con: mobo orientation is horizontal so installation is weird putting in the drive cage is a bit of a hassle the knobs didn't work for me but i didn't put much effort into it. decent case, would probably go for it. But not as a first-time builder
customer_reviews.author: Ojas Sanghi

customer_reviews.title: Well built, slightly awkward but unique case.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first time PC builder, so take some of my opinions with a grain of salt. That being said, this is an excellent case in my opinion. It seems very well built and uniquely designed. It's a bit wonky to try to reach into and work around due to it being a bit cramped and awkward with the horizontal motherboard design, and cable management can be kind of a doozy, but other than that I personally love everything about it. It's well made and it has a lot of personality.
customer_reviews.author: Kuja

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Case!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and clean!! I like how I have room for cable management and plenty room for internal HD,and SSD,, comes with filters all over to keep dust out very awesome not many case do, and I like the layout I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: JERRY LEBOUEF

customer_reviews.title: Good case, had one issue
customer_reviews.text: Great case, had a little issue with the front panel, sometimes the lights/fans that were controlled by it would cut in and out, simple redoing of a connection and it is good to go
customer_reviews.author: NathanB

customer_reviews.title: Decent case
customer_reviews.text: It's a little larger than it looks online but it is a good case. Well engineered in areas. When it comes to installing the Power supply the plate removes on the rear to allow for sliding the power supply in and then the insert that it mounts to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Planned Case
customer_reviews.text: Ive had Problems with every part of this case from putting in the mother board to having to unscrew the frame to get the Power supply in the Hard drive cage buts right up against the fan and you cant get the cords in without excessive amounts of work there is very little room for cord management and i'm going to buy a new case because this one just isn't going to cut it probably a good case for a pro but definitely not a beginner case.
customer_reviews.author: chris barnett

customer_reviews.title: Very useful layout if you've got the room on your desk.
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. Although it's quite large for a micro-ATX case, the layout works great for me. I could have done without the fan control knobs, but that's a relatively minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: EJIII.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: It accents my gaming PC perfectly. All the ports and fans work great and to build it was easy with how the case is set up.
customer_reviews.author: David Millis Jr

customer_reviews.title: was a fun build
customer_reviews.text: Got this case for my brother inlaw and was acualy suprised at how well it all went to gether. plenty of room to work in would buy agin
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Many builds in my history...cheap to premium... This case a little time consuming but worth it in the end!
customer_reviews.author: J.r.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, built good, motherboard sits horizontally, easy to add/remove components.
customer_reviews.text: This case almost seems like a mini-tower, but...your motherboard sits flat, so heavy video cards don't flop up and down if you bump the case. Nice cooling setup, I did replace the front 200mm fan with something a little quieter to go with the quiet water cooler on the CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tice

customer_reviews.title: Good case for airflow for sure.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re worried about air flow DON’T. This thing is wide open. Easy to build in for sure. As far as the materials used it’s ok if not good. The see through is plastic and not glass. It has a very large Footprint as the mobo sits horizontally. This was for my sons build. He picked it and loves the look.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the money its a nice case but its bigger than expected out of a cube. Its more of an extra wide mid tower. Came with more screws and parts than i could ever need for a micro atx case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice case. The hd leds are two red bars ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice case. The hd leds are two red bars on the control panel. The mother board lays down flat on it and not on its edge. We did have to losen the tray mounts to install the big ass fan cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: On par with the Air 540 for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Among the better cases I've ever purchased, at the best price I've gotten. Quality construction with a solid aluminum frame, industrious features and a ton of room for a proper air or water cooled build. Only complaint is that the front panel switch wiring isn't long enough to reach the mb without running the cables vertically in the middle of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this case is easy. Looks great though, like a 1992 office printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Well Made But A Little Bulky
customer_reviews.text: The case very attractive and well made. It is also easy to build into a PC but overall it is a bit bulky for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ozamandiz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like the look has good air flow has room for most components seems to be more fitted for a itx motherboard than a micro atx. a micro atx motherboard will cover the rubber grommets. 200mm fan was loud metal mesh front panel had a round dent and could not fit a optical drive with standard sized GPU
customer_reviews.author: cruz

customer_reviews.title: Not actually hard to build in, recommend zip ties though
customer_reviews.text: Not actually all that hard to build in really, but i recommend using zip ties for cable managment due to the fans
customer_reviews.author: Cory W

customer_reviews.title: Best low budget case
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this case, it holds all the parts of my build in very convenient ways, i haven't seen any downsides besides putting the front panel back on, you can damage the front panel plastic seals if aren't careful enough, also the fact that you remove your motherboard to remove the PSU, outside of that very intuitive design 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Aletse

customer_reviews.title: Neat case, great price, good air flow layout
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. The horizontal mobo rack makes it stand out from any other case I've ever worked with. With a stock ryzen processor and wraith spire cpu cooler it barely makes a noise, let alone breaks a sweat while gaming. Paird with a gtx 1060, I'm able to play any game on max without really noticing fan noise.
customer_reviews.author: Marrix Baily

customer_reviews.title: Big Boi. Wide Boi.
customer_reviews.text: The case looks awesome and is well made. Just be sure you can find a place to put it is pretty big and wide. Right now it is sitting on the floor due to me not having a desk large enough for it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allen Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great value and awesome design to it to work on it with ease. Great space for bigger parts.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this case it was easy to assemble and my mother board fits perfectly in it it has great amount of space to work around with hardware. The only thing I don't like is that the part I was most excited to see doesn't work. Can someone inform me on how to contact the cases company for a replacement .
customer_reviews.author: Rigo Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case, love the design. Many options for cable management and lots of room
customer_reviews.author: Ivory Games

customer_reviews.title: Rexgear 1 Micro ATX Cube Computer Case with...
customer_reviews.text: bigger then i thought it would be, one fan light not working, but case is awsum
customer_reviews.author: DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Big footprint but great case!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case and it great to build in. Used these cases in 3 different builds and all were good. Great airflow too.
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is bigger and roomier than I expected for a Micro ATX case, which was a nice surprise. Installing my components was a breeze, and the fans push a decent amount of air without making a ton of noise. This is a solid case that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GRivas

customer_reviews.title: the parts were easy to install it reeks of real business my grandson ...
customer_reviews.text: the parts were easy to install it reeks of real business my grandson wants one so i will be ordering a another one very soon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Case, More than met my expectations, Has features you usually only see on cases much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Lakos

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price! Looks very similar to the thor v2 with minor diffrences. 10/10 case for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value case
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little case, easy to build in. Was able to fit a msi gtx 1060 with a little room to spare. Looks good and has a great side window to see your gpus fan side clearly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As small as this case is, it does have some weight to it.
customer_reviews.text: An abosultyl wonderful case. I ordered this for a custom build for a customer. I've done some work to it to make it unique. It was very easy to work on, and with the removable motherboard tray, installation was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Rader

customer_reviews.title: Cool Matx case but the rubber cable management cutouts are ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool Matx case but the rubber cable management cutouts are basically useless for most boards. Spacious enough, and very stylish. Remember, this thing is WIDE. It takes up a lot of space, the trade off for a horizontal mobo mount.
customer_reviews.author: Ibraheem Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: The case is bigger than expected, no sharp edges ...
customer_reviews.text: The case is bigger than expected, no sharp edges and can take a beating for the price. Thier are a few things that should be notes. The front panel connectors are on the short side, where a rx 580 is hard to work around. And the so many options this case brings, not a first build case.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Went great how I aspected.
customer_reviews.text: The wires werent long enough how I wanted it in order to contain that perfect cable management. Then again after putting everything all other. The PC came out great and workinf perfect how I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: Case was wonderful! Mostly easy to assemble if you’ve built a couple computers. Great air flow and almost silent! Will definitely buy another one for future builds!
customer_reviews.author: Keith and Autumn Ray

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tower
customer_reviews.text: This tower is great and was easy to assemble. The only problem is one of the fans clicks so i have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lyons

customer_reviews.title: a Great Deal!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this case is awesome. I had no issues at all fitting my micro ATX Ryzen build into it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: great style and surprisingly roomy
customer_reviews.text: A gorgeous case, great style and surprisingly roomy, making cable management pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Aleduran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using it now and it is prefect for a dorm room.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Gaenicke

customer_reviews.title: Great micro/mini case
customer_reviews.text: Tough case to use for a first time build because it is such a tight space but great if you know what you are doing. Would recommend getting an extra fan for the back side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly underrated case. Surprisingly well laid out with lots of options and high build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest this product to any one on a budget. Excellent quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my build
customer_reviews.text: -1 star because this case is not nearly as green as pictured. It shows to be a bright green and is actually a very dark green. Worked great for my build, just with it would have been greener.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Gohier

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT IF YOU HATE BEING SUBTLE
customer_reviews.text: I love “edge lord” PC gear and this fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: M. Manderscheid

customer_reviews.title: Love the amount of space
customer_reviews.text: Love the amount of space, ease of acessability, and the quality of it. The only thing that i have a problem with is the short wires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a very well made computer case.
customer_reviews.text: Great layout. Easy to use and set up. Great price. Would like to see a better and easier to clean filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case except....
customer_reviews.text: The case deserves 5 stars. It's really nice but mine came with the front wire mesh dented in. Not sure if this was a manufacturer defect or shipping damage. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: bintuadnaan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case that feels very nice. My only complaint was How tight every single screw was upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Brunow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice case n easy to work with plus removeable motherboard plate .
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Looks great for kids, bulkier than anticipated and flawed front cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case to make a computer with my son. The style looks great. The case is quite a bit bigger than I had anticipated (though, I didn’t look at the dimensions). The benefit is better cooling, the downside is it isn’t something he could easily handle himself. The bummer is that I believe the case design and materials are flawed. There are plastic nubs on the front cover than insert into metal holes in the case to keep it in place. All the nubs were broken when I popped it out of the box. As a result, the front cover barely stays on. I’ll be returning this back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: slush

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. I like the USB 3.0 and very easy access to the insides with thumb screws
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Not that nice of a case
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool on the outside but inside its off centered and hard to build amd the fan placement is blocked and off centered
customer_reviews.author: Erick Osterloh

product_meta.title: Nanoxia Micro ATX Case for Gaming/Desktop/Cube/Tower - Rexgear 2 Limited Edition, Midnight Garnet Red
product_meta.description: Size:Micro ATX Case| Color:RG 2 Midnight Garnet RedYou won't find many cases with special two-tone paintwork like this! We got Iron Man Red, Midnight Garnet Red, Championship White, Alpine White, Green Hulk, etc. Once they are gone, they are gone. RexGear 2 is an extra wide cube case with plenty of space for cable management, bulky expansion cards, improved airflow, and advanced liquid cooling solutions. This chassis fits full length standard ATX power supply, two large CPU/GPU liquid coolers up to 240/280 mm, and long graphics card length up to 345 mm (with front 20 cm fan removed). Completely removable ODD rack allows easy access to your water cooling solutions. The motherboard plate is removable for easy installation of core components such as CPU, RAM and Motherboard and works great as a computer test bench using AMD Ryzen or as a gaming case. The motherboard's horizontal position also minimizes bending/stress from heavy tower CPU coolers, like the Noctua NH-U12S. You can install a CPU cooler with maximum height of 187 mm (without top fans). You can mount internal 3 x 3.5 inch HDD and 2 x 2.5 inch SSD under the ODD rack. Comes with pre-drilled holes for water cooling pipes for quick heat dissipation. Includes one quiet, large 20 cm fan (front) and one 14 cm fan (rear). Huge open space for a total of 6 case fans: Optional 1 x 20 cm, 2 x 12 cm or 2 x 14 cm fans on top panel / Optional 1 x 20 cm, 2 x 12 cm or 2 x 14 cm fans on front panel / Optional 2 x 12 cm or 2 x 14 cm fans on rear panel. The top panel includes a functional vent for air ventilation and can be easily opened/closed. Includes magnetic PSU dust filter for easy removal and cleaning. Includes rubber pads for 3.5" HDDs and PSU to minimze vibrations and noises. Includes PSU mounting bracket for easy installation of power supply. Front panel includes 2 x USB 3.0, 1 x HD Audio & MIC, and two fan controller knobs that power up a total of six 3-pin case fans. Case dimensions: 16.45 x 11.02 x 16.22 inches.
feature_bullets: Optimized for small form factor builds using Micro-ATX or Mini-ITX motherboard, with smart component placements that do not block long graphics cards or large radiators.
Easy to disassemble & re-assemble: Removable motherboard tray lays flat and let's you get in and change things around quickly (HDD swaps, graphics cards, ram).
Supports dual 240/280 mm water cooling radiators, CPU cooler height 187 mm, GPU length 320 mm, full length PSU, and up to 6 case fans.
Includes 2 x fan controllers (six 3-pin fan connectors), 1 x 20 cm fan (front), 1 x 14 cm fan (rear), magnetic PSU dust filter, anti-vibration rubber pads, PSU bracket.
Case dimensions: 16.45 x 11.02 x 16.22 inches; Limited Edition: we only make these colors in limited quantities.
